title.narrative: Hearts and Heads for Food Sovereignty and Natural Resource Conservation in the Andes

description.narrative: As this project enters Phase II, it will build the capacity of the regional indigenous organization ECUARUNARI to advocate for public policies in defense of the rights of the Kichwa indigenous peoples, their territories and natural resources in their progress toward food sovereignty. The Kichwa face increasingly heavy-handed implementation of governmental policies, which enable agro-industrial, mining, and agri-business corporations to obtain control of land, water and agricultural markets previously belonging to communities and rural families. A lack of adequate information about the agrarian situation of these population groups makes it difficult for the organization to generate alternative proposals. Therefore, their advocacy actions lack the backing and necessary analyses to be taken seriously by diverse stakeholders. Families will conduct research and reflect on the region’s traditional production and governmental policies on natural resources, which will allow them to explore their implications for food sovereignty. This will help ECUARUNARI generate proposals for defending natural resources and policy advocacy actions to incorporate as the government’s public policies. Another goal is advocacy for equitable access to water and income generation by selling traditional Andean products to government programs and community conservation of land. Project implementation will directly involve 1,675 original beneficiaries while another 5,725 people will benefit from passing on the gift.
